info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 10:38AM CDT until September 04 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS... At 1038 AM CDT, emergency management reported 1 to 2 feet of water over Illinois Route 16 east of Irving. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hillsboro, Witt, Taylor Springs, Coffeen, Schram City, Irving, Panama, Coalton, Donnellson and Butler. While the heavy rain has ended for the moment, flooding is already occurring, and additional heavy rain is possible later today. Remain on the lookout for additional flooding and heavy rain through the day. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
